# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(text)
        if length(word) > text_width
            throw(ArgumentError("The width of a single word cannot exceed the specified text width."))
        end
        if length(join(lines, "")) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, "")
        end
        push!(lines, word)
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
text = "Hello world. This is a very long sentence that should wrap at the specified width."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 20)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This function splits the text into words and iterates over them. It checks if the combined length of the current line plus the word exceeds the specified `text_width`. If so, it adds a new line to the result. The `join` function is used to concatenate the lines with empty strings when needed, and then the final string is joined with newline characters between each line.
